results.title: Road to the stamping ground
results.creator_credit: David Muir, RM Arts and Nederlandse Omroep Stichting
results.brief_description: A choreographical journey with Jiri Kylian of the Netherland’s Dance Theatre into the world of dance in Indigenous Australia. The documentary which opens the program follows Kylian’s visit to the Groot Eylandt tribal dance congregation in 1986 where his dance production Stamping Ground was first conceived. In Stamping Ground Kylian sought to underline the common qualities of ballet and Aboriginal tribal dance as well as fuse the two styles into a work that comments on the universal nature of human movement as a form of cultural and personal expression. Following interviews with the Dance company performers about the piece and footage of rehearsals demonstrating movements inspired by Kylian’s time at the Groot Eylandt congregation, the second half of the program is a presentation of the final performance of Stamping Ground by the Netherlands Dance Theatre Company.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Muir, RM Arts and Nederlandse Omroep Stichting

results.title: Surface tension
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Karena Slaninka and Moira Moss
results.brief_description: Freida has something to tell Nick, but she doesn’t know what she feels or how to express it. The unspoken is the source of a tension that grows and grows and eventually must burst like a bubble rising to the surface. Original format 16mm.
results.description: Freida has something to tell Nick, but she doesn’t know what she feels or how to express it. The unspoken is the source of a tension that grows and grows and eventually must burst like a bubble rising to the surface. Original format 16mm.

results.title: Freestyle
results.creator_credit: Matt Morgan, David Lowe and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A man is murdered in a swimming pool at the beach. But did anyone actually witness the event? Cast features Mary-Lou Stewart, Roy Billing, Monique Spanbrook, Greg Blandy.

results.title: Code blue
results.creator_credit: Andrew O'Sullivan, Pascal Guilloux, Moira Moss and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A busy intersection in a large city. Everyone is going about their own business - waiting to cross the road, minding their children…A jay-walker is run over by a courier van. How fast can the city heal itself? ‘Code blue’ is a tightly directed and beautifully paced film which has screened at over 20 festivals throughout the world. The film’s blue tones help to create a tense and emotive ten minute journey through a fast city.

results.title: Robert Richard Torrens
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An account of the origin and history of the Torrens Title System. Shows Torrens’ work as Registrar-General and Member of Parliament, in the securing of land tenure in South Australia. Insecurity had plagued early settlers in South Australia, until Torrens’ land title reform bill was passed in 1857. Unsatisfactory registered transactions were replaced by a single certificate, one copy being held by the Registrar-General and the other by the owner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lilias Fraser, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Road to Alice
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Frances McGivern and Stavros Kazantzidis
results.brief_description: Jimmy (Noah Taylor) owes Dimitri more money than he can spare. He decides that a holiday would be a better bet. On his travels he meets Louis (Hugo Weaving) and things start to go wrong. Cast also includes Helen Buday, Leone Carmen, Angelo D’Angelo, Emil Minty. Best Short Film, AFI Awards (1992). Original format 16mm/colour.

results.title: Clint Eastwood
results.creator_credit: Ray Atherton and Passport International Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood remembers”.
Speak softly and carry a big gun…that’s the attitude that has made Clint Eastwood one of the biggest box office stars! And this video looks at his entire film career, from the early “Spaghetti Westerns”made in Italy to his Hollywood superstar years with “Dirty Harry” and beyond. Featured are rare film clips, original coming attractions, previews, and more, including footage never released to television. It’s a treasure trove featuring Eastwood’s best work, and the first serious retrospective of his lengthy acting career. Whether you’re an Eastwood fan, a film buff, or an action-adventure afficionado, this is a video you’ll want to watch over and over again.

results.title: Sex rules
results.brief_description:
Jo and Nik are best friends until they start having to contend with boys and sex. When Jo finds out that her favourite teacher has AIDS, she becomes obsessed with the subject and bases her school artwork on the theme of safe sex. At the same time Nik is becoming involved with a boy and decides to have sex with him without a condom.
Cast features Kirsty McGregor as Jo and Angelica Klages as Nik.

results.title: Warren Beatty
results.creator_credit: Ray Atherton and Passport International Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood remembers”.
Warren Beatty’s reputation as a great romantic figure both on and off the screen has enthralled audiences throughout his career. Using rare film clips, production stills and coming attraction trailers this video provides an insight into his performances as an actor and his efforts as a producer and director. Also presents information about his personal life highlighting his more famous romantic encounters.
